intro: Tetrapogon spathaceus, commonly known as the spathaceous tetrapogon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
